author: Jim Carlton
title: Another Bad Ski Season Puts Small Resorts in the West in Jeopardy
text:
NORDEN, Calif.—After a late-season dump of heavy snow last week, Janet Tuttle, co-owner of the Donner Ski Ranch, should have been smiling at the crowd of skiers and snowboarders descending on this small resort tucked in the Sierra Nevada mountains.
“It would have been better if it had been here three months ago,” Ms. Tuttle said Sunday, looking out the window of her office at skiers lining up for chairlifts.
